#Text=Ontario Votes 2007 : Interview with Green candidate Jim Reeves , York-Simcoe
#Text=Monday , October 1 , 2007
#Text=Jim Reeves is running for the Green Party of Ontario in the Ontario provincial election , in the York-Simcoe riding .
#Text=Wikinews ' Nick Moreau interviewed him regarding his values , his experience , and his campaign .
#Text=Stay tuned for further interviews ; every candidate from every party is eligible , and will be contacted .

#Text=Expect interviews from Liberals , Progressive Conservatives , New Democratic Party members , Ontario Greens , as well as members from the Family Coalition , Freedom , Communist , Libertarian , and Confederation of Regions parties , as well as independents .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=Why did you choose to run in this constituency ?

#Text=I have been active for many years in business and environmental organization in York Region and am increasingly concerned about the indiscriminate development , and the lack of effective steps by the major parties to protect the Lake Simcoe watershed .

#Text=I see in the Green Party policy many ideas which if implemented could greatly improve not only environmental health , but the practical aspects of education , social welfare and health care delivery in our province .
#Text=I have lived in Georgina since 1978 and would be proud to represent my home constituency .
#Text=What prior political experience do you have ?
#Text=What skills and insights can you bring to office , from other non-political positions you may have held ?
#Text=While I have no specific political experience , I have served on many boards .
#Text=Business related : Canadian Retail Hardware Association , as director on the committee for legislative affairs .
#Text=Canadian Tire Dealers Association , at different times , committees on marketing , logistics , and warehousing .
#Text=Provincial : Workplace Health and Safety , and Social : Association for Community Living , York Environmental Stewardship .
#Text=As an engineer and having my MBA I have a very practical approach to problems and I believe that I can bring a creative and practical point of view , incorporating new technologies .
#Text=Which of you competitors do you expect to pose the biggest challenge to your candidacy ? Why ?
#Text=What makes you the most desirable candidate running in the riding ?
#Text=As a Green Party candidate I recognize that all the major parties pose a big challenge .
#Text=They all have established riding constituencies and financial support far beyond anything we can realistically expect in this election .
#Text=However the Green Party represents the grass roots and will be better able to put forward the issues of growth in harmony with the environment , and protection of the Lake Simcoe watershed .
#Text=They are both issues very important to the riding .
#Text=What do you feel are the three most important issues to voters in your riding ?
#Text=Are these the same top three issues most important to you ?
#Text=What would you do to address these issues ?
#Text=Bad development : The extensive building of single family dwellings , with no centre of shopping , amenities ,
#Text=No job growth in the developments or nearby .
#Text=People have to commute , causing more smog , congestion and air pollution .
#Text=Degradation of the Lake Simcoe watershed .
#Text=This degradation is taking place as a result of poor water management , smelter byproducts , dumps and the paving over of large areas of the Oak Ridge ’s Moraine .
